com.illposed.osc

Class OSCPortOut

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illposed.osc.OSCPort
      • com.illposed.osc.OSCPortOut

  • public class OSCPortOut
extends OSCPort
    OSCPortOut is the class that sends OSC messages to a specific address and port. To send an OSC message, call send(OSCPacket). An example:
    (loosely based on {com.illposed.osc.OSCPortTest#testMessageWithArgs()}) 
    
 OSCPort sender = new OSCPort();
 List<Object> args = new ArrayList<Object>(2);
 args.add(3);
 args.add("hello");
 OSCMessage msg = new OSCMessage("/sayhello", args);
 try {
 	sender.send(msg);
 } catch (Exception ex) {
 	showError("Couldn't send");
 }

      Constructor and Description
      OSCPortOut()

      Create an OSCPort that sends to address, using the standard SuperCollider port.
      OSCPortOut(java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      Create an OSCPort that sends to address:port.
      OSCPortOut(java.net.InetAddress address, int port, java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
      Create an OSCPort that sends to address:port using a specified socket.

      • OSCPortOut

        public OSCPortOut()
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                  java.net.SocketException
        Create an OSCPort that sends to "localhost", on the standard SuperCollider port.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the local host name could not be resolved into an address
        java.net.SocketException - when failing to create a (UDP) out socket
